title: Is teenage love worth it? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, and I’ll explain why. These days we see many teenagers with boyfriends and girlfriends. But most of the time, they end up with heartbreak. Leaving maybe one or both the people in a terrible state of mind. That is a very strong reason why teen love isn’t worthwhile. But heartbreak has many good sides to it. How you maybe be asking? When you go through a heartbreak, most people are at the most vulnerable or lowest point in their life. Moving on is a hard thing. So when you go through a heartbreak, you learn to let go. Which is a huge life lesson? You learn to love yourself, and learn self-worth! The sadness is overwhelming but the amount of things you learn from teen love is amazing. You learn that maybe they aren’t the one? You learn how to love other people, and how other people love you back. Love is love. People think it’s a waste of time. But you gain so much experience! Maybe in your next relationship, you can change it up, and better yourself for you and your partner! (If you have any questions regarding this, or need some clarification, don’t hesitate and please comment them down!) ~ Angie

I’d say any love is worth it. Teen love is special, in my opinion. It’s like a whole new world that sweeps you off of your feet, the kind of thing you remember when you’re old and reminisce about. There’s something so sweet and innocent about young love, and I’m one of the people that thinks teens have the capability of love! Give it a chance. If it doesn’t work out, it doesn’t work out. But if it does, it does! People change as they grow up, and they can grow apart, and that’s okay. But if you love your significant other, then don’t give up on the relationship just because teen love isn’t “worth it”. Age doesn’t invalidate your feelings, in my opinion. Best of luck!

It can definitely be an important experience. Most relationships at that age do not last, but some do. I’d wait until at least 17 though to start dating. I think it’s worth it in the sense that we grow a lot from our experiences whether or not they work out and help us see things in a different light whether that ends in heartbreak 99% of the time or that 1% that doesn’t. Either way it is an experience. It’s really up to what that person who experiences it to determine if it was worthwhile for them.

yesyesyesyesyesyesyes it is so worth it. just feeling of being swept off your feet by someone is amazing. it is just so great. i know that my boyfriend will read this (he found my quora and pinterest help :)) so hey lol :)) <3 stop saying you’re as white as your shirt okay it is so worth it. xoxox, maddy :))))

Oh yes! Why not! You get to have all those fluttering exciting jittery feelings of love without any concern of the complicated responsibilities of life. In fact you get to experience love in an innocent form only when you are a teenager. And even if it doesn’t work out, it’s a worthy experience from which you can learn and not commit the same mistakes in future. If you want to know more about teen love, read Young teens love - An exciting yet beautiful journey of life - Wordspective Hope it helps! :)

No, in fact from what ive seen dating in early teen years, can negativly affect one from having healthy relationships. It seems teens have an unrealistic expectations of relationships on average, and these expectations are carried over into adulthood, things such as extreme jealously, leaving when thier partner isnt being to thier will at every moment, or the most common not loving your partner but loving being in a relationship. Of course this isnt a hard fast rule, its just been from my observation and experience that dating early in life will make relationships much much harder in the future from bad habbits, and misconceptions. And the people who i see start dating in thier late teens early 20s, generally have healthier relationships, and lives outside of thier relationship. Like i said, this is not a rule just observations i have made in my short life.

In the sense that it teaches you how to do relationships and especially what sorts of things you should never ever accept in your adult relationships, yes. Probably less than 1% of the time does teen love last, but I think it's often a good experience.

Of course I do. I’ve been with my girlfriend since the age of 16 and we are in a very good spot in our relationship. It’s been almost 5 years and we are still going strong. We are on track to move in together in our dream neighborhood, have children, and advancing our daytime careers. I do believe in teenage love working out in the long term. We are living breathing proof of it.

Teen love is real; the problem with it is that in today’s society there is no place for it to be practical. Teenagers do not have the skills or training to be financially independent to be able to build a lifetime commitment with someone. Consequently,falling in love is not a reasonable goal to pursue at that age. Working hard to attain the goals of independence so one can have more and better opportunities in the future is the best option to my mind.

Trust me it’s worth it. Teen love is one of the most incredible experience of your life and could turn out to be the most heart-breaking moment but this memories will stay with you throughout your life and and who know, you might even meet the love of your life in the process.
It’s not worth it. Focus on your studies, whoever is trying to pursue you while you’re underage is selfish.
